medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe anaphylaxis due to camel milk protein.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms had a sudden onset after consuming fresh camel milk, leading to cough, wheezing, itching, and facial swelling. The patient was unresponsive upon arrival to the emergency department and experienced respiratory distress.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Asthma, eczema, food allergies (allergic to peanut, multiple tree nuts, coconut, and sesame). Four emergency visits and three hospital admissions for asthma exacerbations.
medical_history.family_history: Two siblings with asthma; father has asthma; mother has allergic rhinitis, contact dermatitis, and allergies to local anesthetics.
